JAMMU: J&K Police have arrested a middle-aged Sikh man in Samba district for allegedly desecrating the Guru Granth Sahib.Police said the alleged “sacrilegious act” was carried out by Manjit Singh alias Billa of Koulpur village in Ramgarh at a local gurdwara. Article Title: Connor McDavid’s future with Oilers faces new uncertainty as insider claims owner Daryl Katz is growing impatient
Article Text:
Edmonton Oilers captain Connor McDavid's contract uncertainty is causing significant unease within the franchise as he enters his final year. Owner Daryl Katz is reportedly "antsy" over the delay, despite no animosity. NHL insider Darren Dreger suggests a 50-50 chance of an extension, possibly a short-term deal, leaving the team's future in McDavid's hands.

Oilers ownership reportedly getting restless over contract delay

TSN's Darren Dreger On McDavid & Crosby's Futures, 2025 Flames & More | The Insider Hotline

Connor McDavid stays composed amid speculation

As the Edmonton Oilers prepare for the 2025-26 NHL season, all eyes are on their captain, Connor McDavid, who is entering the final year of his eight-year, $100 million contract. Despite his incredible impact on the franchise, McDavid’s future in Edmonton remains uncertain and according to NHL insider Darren Dreger, that uncertainty is starting to make the organization nervous.During a recent segment, Dreger revealed that Oilers owner Daryl Katz is becoming “a little antsy” as Connor McDavid continues to deliberate on his next move. While Darren Dreger clarified that there’s “no animosity” between McDavid and the front office, he admitted there’s growing unease within the organization about the lack of progress..“There's no animosity here,” Dreger explained. “Is there nervousness building? Sure, you know, I mean, Daryl Katz is probably getting a little antsy, the owner of the Edmonton Oilers. And then that message would be delivered to Jeff Jackson and on to Stan Bowman, the general manager.”Dreger noted that Edmonton is “ready to close whenever Connor is ready,” but the timeline remains entirely in Connor McDavid’s hands. He estimated the chances of an extension happening soon at “50-50” and suggested that any potential deal could be short-term, possibly just two years, a prospect that could unsettle both management and fans.While some worry about the distractions, NHL analyst Eddie Olczyk believes McDavid won’t let the situation affect his performance. “Well, I don't think it's going to hang over Connor McDavid because, just, he breathes different air,” Olczyk said. “I don't think it's going to affect him one bit.”Also Read: Edmonton Oilers reportedly exploring shocking reunion with 40-year-old Marc-Andre Fleury Since his debut in 2015, McDavid has consistently proven to be a generational player, leading Edmonton to consecutive Stanley Cup Final appearances and surpassing the 100-point mark eight times. Still, as Dreger put it, “He’s a unicorn.” The Oilers may be anxious, but the next move and the franchise’s future, ultimately depends on when McDavid decides the time is right.
Article Summary: Connor McDavid is entering the final year of his eight-year, $100 million contract. Owner Daryl Katz is reportedly "antsy" over the delay, despite no animosity. Darren Dreger suggests a 50-50 chance of an extension, possibly a short-term deal.

Article Title: Arturo Gatti Jr, son of boxing legend found dead at 17 in Mexico apartment
Article Text:
Arturo Gatti Jr, son of boxing legend found dead at 17 in Mexico apartment (Image via Getty)

Arturo Gatti Jr.’s life and sudden death in Mexico

“It is unfortunately not a rumor or a joke.

Arturo is gone.”

Arturo Gatti Sr.’s death and the mystery that remains

Arturo Gatti Jr. is dead at just 17. He was found hanging in an apartment in Mexico on October 7, 2025. The news was first reported by French-Canadian network TVA Nouvelles. Arturo Jr. was living there with his mother, Amanda Rodrigues. A neighbor discovered his body. His death comes 16 years after the shocking death of his father, boxing legend Arturo Gatti. The news has shaken the boxing world. Friends, fighters, and fans are mourning the loss of a young talent.Arturo Gatti Jr. was born in 2008, ten months before his father’s death. He began boxing when he was six years old. He fought in amateur bouts and dreamed of becoming a professional. His longtime coach, Moe Latif, confirmed the death in an Instagram post. He wrote,Latif was due to travel to Mexico this week to continue training him.The first tribute came from Chuck Zito, an American actor and former bodyguard of Arturo Sr. On October 8, Zito posted on Instagram that Arturo Jr. had been found hanging in Mexico. He shared old photos of the father and son. He also sent condolences to Arturo’s sisters, brothers, and daughter Sophia.Arturo Gatti Jr. also had a close friendship with Mike Tyson.The boxing legend saw great promise in him. Fans hoped he would carry on his father’s legacy. His sudden passing has left the boxing community heartbroken.Arturo “Thunder” Gatti was one of boxing’s most exciting fighters. He won world titles in two weight classes. He is best remembered for his three famous fights with Micky Ward. On July 11, 2009, Gatti was found dead in Porto de Galinhas, Brazil. He was on vacation with his wife Amanda Rodrigues and infant son.Also Read: Cristiano Ronaldo Surprises With Baldness Confession While Football’s First Billionaire Launches Wellness Clinic In Saudi Arabia His body was found on the floor of a condo. He had head wounds, bruises, and a deep mark on his neck. At first, Brazilian police arrested Rodrigues for murder. She was released later. Authorities ruled the death a suicide by hanging. Many close to Gatti refused to believe this.His manager, Pat Lynch, hired private investigators in 2011. They claimed Gatti was knocked unconscious and strangled. But a Quebec coroner later said there was not enough evidence to prove murder or suicide. The case remains a mystery.Now, with Arturo Gatti Jr.’s tragic death at only 17, the pain has returned for the Gatti family. Both father and son are gone in similar shocking circumstances.
Article Summary: Arturo Gatti Jr. was found hanging in an apartment in Mexico on October 7, 2025. His death comes 16 years after the shocking death of his father, boxing legend Arturo 'Thunder' Gatti. The news has shaken the boxing world. Friends, fighters, and fans are mourning the loss of a young talent.
